alert.note: Alert for Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 10:36PM EDT until May 19 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Knox County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 1115 PM EDT. * At 1036 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lancaster to near Mount Carmel, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Decker, Vincennes, Vincennes University, Bruceville, Bicknell, Monroe City and Wheatland. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
